briefing.opening: Good morning. Welcome to the climate briefing for February 24, 2026. Today, news reports highlighted warnings about the severity of climate change both domestically and internationally, alongside various efforts to transition towards a carbon-neutral society.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ The Reality of the Climate Crisis: Spreading Warnings and Ecosystem Changes
sections.content: News collected today clearly demonstrates that the threats posed by climate change are becoming a reality. Domestically, the very existence of the Winter Olympics is under threat, with a grim prediction that it 'will disappear like melting snow' [3, 6]. Furthermore, 85 wildfires occurred on the Korean Peninsula this month alone, with climate change identified as the primary cause, and research indicates a threefold increase in global wildfire risk [30, 175, 185]. In Uljin, a special photo exhibition showcasing the changing marine ecosystem due to climate change was held, visually illustrating the crisis facing marine ecosystems [1, 17]. Internationally, California's winter storms were deemed insufficient to alleviate climate change concerns, with reports of more dangerous avalanches, sea-level rise, and superbug issues [161, 165, 166, 170, 179]. As such, climate change is having widespread impacts across our daily lives and natural ecosystems.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Policies and Industry Efforts Towards Carbon Neutrality Goals
sections.content: Amidst this crisis, various domestic efforts to transition to a carbon-neutral society continue. Gwangmyeong City has embarked on developing a data-driven smart carbon-neutral city model, aiming to complete the model by November and conduct integrated verification in the Gwangmyeong Station area [31, 32, 33, 39, 46, 54, 57, 68, 71, 73, 75, 87, 99, 103, 104, 107, 108, 116]. Hyundai Department Store has set new ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) standards in the retail sector, as five of its eco-friendly activities, including the use of reusable containers and tumblers, were officially included in the government's Carbon Neutrality Point System, allowing customers to earn points [34, 45, 49, 50, 52, 55, 56, 61, 65, 66, 67, 72, 74, 77, 78, 82, 85, 88, 90, 93, 94, 97, 100, 102, 111, 112, 113, 115, 117, 160]. The Ministry of Trade, Industry and Energy is recruiting companies to participate in the 'Carbon Neutrality Transition Leading Project Loan Support Program' with an interest rate of 1.3%, providing loans totaling 80 billion won to encourage the industry's transition to carbon neutrality [42, 44, 92, 95, 110]. Furthermore, Chungnam Province pledged to achieve 'Carbon Neutrality by 2045' and began operating its 14th hydrogen charging station to accelerate carbon neutrality through hydrogen vehicles [48, 59, 60]. The National Assembly Climate Change Forum selected 13 recipients for the '2026 Republic of Korea Green Climate Award,' commending organizations that have contributed to climate change response [5].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Accelerating Renewable Energy Expansion and Enhancing Citizen Participation
sections.content: There was also abundant news encouraging the expansion of renewable energy supply and citizen participation in climate action. Jeonbuk Self-Governing Province is collaborating with relevant organizations such as Saemangeum Development and Investment Agency and Korea Electric Power Corporation to accelerate renewable energy deployment and work together to make Jeonbuk a renewable energy hub [119, 120, 126, 128, 132, 135, 137, 140, 141, 144, 145, 146, 150]. The Korea National Railway has demonstrated the potential for renewable energy transition through public-private technological cooperation by pursuing the expansion of 'railway-type renewable energy' through an MOU with Hanwha Q CELLS [123, 124, 139, 151, 154]. The Ministry of Climate and Environment has launched the 'Power System Innovation Task Force' with the goal of accommodating 100GW of renewable energy, accelerating the establishment of a stable power supply system [130, 133]. Meanwhile, the Cheongju Climate Change Experience Center has completed its remodeling and will reopen on March 4, signaling citizen-participatory carbon neutrality education [2, 8, 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 22, 23]. In Wonju, the Climate Change Promotion Center is hosting a special exhibition titled 'Renewable Energy in Daily Life for Carbon Neutrality' to help citizens understand the topic [4, 10, 18, 19, 20, 21, 26, 27, 89, 101, 118, 148, 153, 158]. Additionally, the launch of the Incheon Carbon Neutrality Practice Promotion Team and the recruitment of participants for the 'Automobile Carbon Neutrality Point' system in various local governments including Paju, Goyang, Hamyang, Yeongju, and Yangpyeong are encouraging citizens' daily efforts to reduce carbon emissions [35, 36, 38, 41, 43, 47, 51, 53, 62, 63, 69, 70, 76, 79, 81, 83, 84, 91, 96, 98, 105, 106, 109, 114, 152, 155, 157].

sections.title: ğŸŒ Global Climate Governance and Awareness Raising: Legal and Media Responses
sections.content: Internationally, discussions were active regarding legal responsibility for climate change and the role of media. The U.S. Supreme Court agreed to hear arguments from oil and gas companies seeking to block climate change lawsuits and to review key issues in related litigation, drawing attention to legal judgments on corporate climate responsibility [163, 164, 167, 168, 169, 171, 172, 173, 176, 178, 181, 182, 183]. Meanwhile, environmental activist Chris Packham urged broadcasters to improve their climate change reporting, criticizing many mainstream media outlets for not telling the truth or remaining silent, thereby emphasizing the media's role in raising climate change awareness [184]. In India, 30 communicators attended a 5-day virtual workshop on the nexus between business and climate change, strengthening their climate communication capabilities [174]. Additionally, energy and industrial policy changes in the Asian region are gaining international attention, such as China accelerating carbon neutrality in maritime logistics with its 'shipbuilding + battery' technology, and Malaysia reconsidering its path to achieving net-zero [64, 187, 188].

briefing.closing: As you have seen in today's briefing, climate change is a global threat, but simultaneously, diverse efforts and technological innovations are underway to overcome it. We emphasize once again that our responsibility and actions to overcome the climate crisis are more crucial than ever. This concludes today's climate briefing.
